content: (The cost to doing this is that a move of an A needs to write 8 bytes instead of the 7, because it needs to make sure that the memory is zeroed for the third field, rather than it being fine with that byte being whatever.)
(that's a pretty low cost because moving 7 bytes is awkward to begin with)
Hm, I think it should be the difference between writing two bytes instead of one
Since the optimized version of A will still have 6 padding bytes probably
Correction: writing 10 bytes instead of 9 bytes. (The 8/7 in my previous were a brain fart.)
For what it's worth I have benchmarked various use cases with this hack and determined no measurable impact on performance. I use it in the time crate where there's padding otherwise.
